title: What was boards meant to achieve?
body: The forums here are basically dead, and even on NA none of the "hot" threads have one Riot post. It's deliberately made so that no matter how big a thread gets it will fall off the big pages. Communication with Rioters is at an all time low, and discussion is either circlejerks or pointless. What was the implementation of boards meant to accomplish, the formatting is the worst of any forum I have ever seen and it hasn't contributed to anything positive....

replies.body:
It isn't a forum. That's why you're so confused, stop treating it like a vBulletin forum.

It's...Reddit 2.0! Unfortunately Reddit styled discussion doesn't work with a small community. It is painful with a small population. Which is why OCE should never even have Boards to this day. 

Why can't Boards work like the forums you may ask? Because Riot encourages the jerking of circles (which is why they love /r/leagueoflegends). They don't want to look through bad posts, only the circlejerked ones. The forums were so toxic, which is why I liked them. 

Boards is Boring, Forums were Fun. But what is more important is that you adjust.
rav senpai cleanse me from my pantheon usage

It's not just OCE though. Everyone knew boards would kill any OCE community forums, but on NA communication is at an all time low, and this is because Riot no longer have to reply to anything. No matter how big a thread gets, Riot can make it disappear 5 days later.

Also, the formatting is far worse than reddit. I tried to explain something to someone and Jimz randomly replied to me with one of his posing-as-cool-rioter things because he didn't know who I was replying to....
Don't you know if it looks fancy we can forget problems at hand
My point about the "hot" section has already been proven. my post has been hidden completely despite the fact that it's activity should make it be close to the top.
It was meant to achieve a status of being reddit 2.0 but less popular
